reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Glockenhof one night, our first stop on our driving trip to Italy. They were very disorganized at check in, we had to wait for our room even though it was after 1400. Once checked in, the Glockenhof was fine, nice room and very clean. Good location in Zurich, close to everything. We were going to stay here for our flight out but changed to the Hilton at the airport since our flight departed in the a.m. The Hilton was great and we were very happy with that decision.
reviews.title: Decent enough place, good location

reviews.text: We stayed in the BW Premier Glockenhof on the first night of our arrival in Zurich from the States. We had a room with a double and a single and it was extremely large. The pictures on the hotel website are right on -- and the rooms are comfortable, large and well maintained. My husband wasn't thrilled with the bathrooms, which are very modern and include a separate shower, bath and toilet area -- the only glass that was frosted was the toilet area and the rest of the area, including the shower, could be easily viewed from the main sleeping area. We had a bit of trouble operating the lights upon arrival due to a combination of jetlag and too many switches, but we finally got the hang of it. Nice sitting area -- with leather chair and loveseat and table. Room was literally huge and very comfortable. Also included were robes and slippers which made the hardwood floors much more comfortable.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel also had a lovely garden cafe with great service. We were given complimentary drink coupons and thoroughy enjoyed our drinks and banana split.
reviews.title: Great Business Hotel

reviews.text: The included breakfast buffet was very nice, and included the standard items as well as fresh fruit and soft-boiled eggs.
reviews.title: Enjoyed Glockenhof after reservation glitch
"A" for effort
reviews.text: The hotel is not super close to the rail station, but can be easily managed with luggage. We were there on a Sunday night and found the hotel to be very quiet.

reviews.title: highly recommended
reviews.text: Either alone or with my spouse I have stayed at this hotel on three occasions in the past three years and we are booked to return next month. Zurich hotels are generally expensive. The hotel is centrally located and within a block of the Bahnhofstrasse and near old town sites and good restaurants.

As other travelers have pointed out, the bathroom arrangement takes a lot of getting used to, even when you are alone in a room. I took me ages to find out how the lighting system works, was even afraid I would have to sleep with the lights on. The hotel should absolutely provide an explanation of how it works. Also, I would have much preferred wall-to-wall carpeting instead of the bare wooden floor, but I presume it is more hygienic. Otherwise everything fine, it has some nice touches like a Nespresso coffee machine and capsules. Travelers please take note that most Swiss hotels still have not understood that air-conditioning now is a must - this hotel has it. In Summer, this alone justifies the quite steep price (a good breakfast is also included). Location for shoppers and visitors to the banks could not be better.
reviews.title: Convenient location

likes.disliked: — The lighting system in the room

reviews.text: The Glockenhof hotel is located right in the middle of the city, very close to the main street of Zurich (excellent for brand name shopping), and very close to the Stock Exchange and the financial district. Its about a 5 to 10 minute walk to the main Zurich train station.
reviews.title: Convenient, Clean and Modern

reviews.text: The room that I stayed in was quite modern. Obviously renovated quite recently. The most striking aspect of the room of course was the huge clear glass window seperating the bathroom and the rest of the room. Now this is great if you like to watch TV while in the shower, and dont mind your partner having a prime view, however if you are staying with someone who is very shy when using the bathroom, this place might not be for you.
reviews.title: Nice enough hotel in the centre

reviews.text: A nice feature of the room is an espresso coffee machine which unfortunately I didnt get a chance to try,
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: The lcd TV had many channels, only 3 of which were in english (BBC1,CNN,Bloomberg). There were many other UK channels available however at a cost (charged in 5 minute blocks).
reviews.title: Great Location
